translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The eighth section
The discussion of the life faculty
“Is there a material life faculty?”
“Yes.”

original: Natthi rūpīnaṁ dhammānaṁ āyu ṭhiti yapanā yāpanā iriyanā vattanā pālanāti?
analyzed: natthi rūpīnam dhammānam āyu ṭhiti yapanā yāpanā iriyanā vattanā pālanā ati
translated: “Is there no life faculty of material phenomena—the life, stability, maintenance, continuation, preservation, and protection of material phenomena?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the past, the future, and the present?” …

original: atthi rūpīnaṁ dhammānaṁ āyu ṭhiti yapanā yāpanā iriyanā vattanā pālanāti?
analyzed: atthi rūpīnam dhammānam āyu ṭhiti yapanā yāpanā iriyanā vattanā pālanā ati
translated: “Is there a life faculty of material phenomena—the life, stability, maintenance, continuation, preservation, and protection of material phenomena?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci atthi rūpīnaṁ dhammānaṁ āyu ṭhiti yapanā yāpanā iriyanā vattanā pālanā, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci atthi rūpīnam dhammānam āyu ṭhiti yapanā yāpanā iriyanā vattanā pālanā no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”🔽“If there is a life faculty of material phenomena—the life, stability, maintenance, continuation, preservation, and protection of material phenomena, then you should say that there is a material life faculty.

If there is no material life faculty, then you should say that there is no life faculty of material phenomena—the life, stability, maintenance, continuation, preservation, and protection of material phenomena.”

original: Atthi arūpīnaṁ dhammānaṁ āyu ṭhiti yapanā yāpanā iriyanā vattanā pālanā, atthi arūpajīvitindriyanti?
analyzed: atthi arūpīnam dhammānam āyu ṭhiti yapanā yāpanā iriyanā vattanā pālanā atthi arūpa jīvitindriyanti
translated: “Is there a life faculty of immaterial phenomena—the life, stability, maintenance, continuation, preservation, and protection of immaterial phenomena? Is there an immaterial life faculty?”
“Yes.”

original: Atthi rūpīnaṁ dhammānaṁ āyu ṭhiti yapanā yāpanā iriyanā vattanā pālanā, atthi rūpajīvitindriyanti?
analyzed: atthi rūpīnam dhammānam āyu ṭhiti yapanā yāpanā iriyanā vattanā pālanā atthi rūpa jīvita indriya nti
translated: “Is there a life faculty of material phenomena—the life, stability, maintenance, continuation, preservation, and protection of material phenomena? Is there a material life faculty?”
“Is it so that one who is not a trainee is not a person who has entered upon the way?” …

original: atthi rūpīnaṁ dhammānaṁ āyu ṭhiti yapanā yāpanā iriyanā vattanā pālanā, natthi rūpajīvitindriyanti?
analyzed: atthi rūpīnam dhammānam āyu ṭhiti yapanā yāpanā iriyanā vattanā pālanā natthi rūpa jīvita indriya nti
translated: Is there a life-force of material phenomena, their continuance, maintenance, and preservation, but not a material life faculty?
You have agreed.

original: Atthi arūpīnaṁ dhammānaṁ āyu ṭhiti yapanā yāpanā iriyanā vattanā pālanā, natthi arūpajīvitindriyanti?
analyzed: atthi arūpīnam dhammānam āyu ṭhiti yapanā yāpanā iriyanā vattanā pālanā natthi arūpa jīvitindriya nti
translated: Is there a life-force of immaterial phenomena, their continuance, maintenance, and preservation, but not an immaterial life faculty?
You have agreed.

analyzed: arūpīnam dhammānam āyu arūpa jīvita indriyanti
translated: Is the life-force of immaterial phenomena an immaterial life faculty?
You have agreed.

original: Rūpīnaṁ dhammānaṁ āyu rūpajīvitindriyanti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…🔽rūpīnaṁ dhammānaṁ āyu na vattabbaṁ—
analyzed: rūpīnam dhammānam āyu rūpa jīvita indriyanti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe  rūpīnam dhammānam āyu na vattabba
translated: Is the life-force of material phenomena a material life faculty?🔽You have agreed.
Is the life-force of material phenomena not to be spoken of as a material life faculty?

analyzed: āmantā  arūpīnam dhammānam āyu na vattabba
translated: You have agreed.
Is the life-force of immaterial phenomena not to be spoken of as an immaterial life faculty?
You have agreed.

analyzed: rūpīnam dhammānam āyu arūpa jīvita indriyanti
translated: Is the life-force of material phenomena an immaterial life faculty?
You have agreed.

analyzed: arūpīnam dhammānam āyu rūpa jīvita indriyanti
translated: Is the life-force of immaterial phenomena a material life faculty?

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….🔽Arūpīnaṁ dhammānaṁ āyu na vattabbaṁ—
analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  arūpīnam dhammānam āyu na vattabba
translated: You have agreed.
Is the life-force of immaterial phenomena not to be spoken of as a material life faculty?
The life faculty of form-sphere beings should not be said to be either.🔽
Is the life-faculty of form-sphere phenomena not to be called the formless life-faculty?
You shouldn’t say so.

analyzed: rūpīnaṃ ca arūpīnaṃ ca dhammānaṃ āyu arūpa jīvita indriyanti
translated: Is the life-faculty of form-sphere and formless-sphere phenomena the formless life-faculty?
Yes.

analyzed: rūpīnaṃ ca arūpīnaṃ ca dhammānaṃ āyu rūpa jīvita indriyanti
translated: Is the life-faculty of form-sphere and formless-sphere phenomena the form-sphere life-faculty?

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….🔽Rūpīnañca arūpīnañca dhammānaṁ āyu na vattabbaṁ—
analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  rūpīnaṃ ca arūpīnaṃ ca dhammānaṃ āyu na vattabba
translated: You shouldn’t say so.
Is the life-faculty of form-sphere and formless-sphere phenomena not to be called the form-sphere life-faculty?

original: Āmantā.🔽Rūpīnañca arūpīnañca dhammānaṁ āyu na vattabbaṁ—
analyzed: āmantā  rūpīnaṃ ca arūpīnaṃ ca dhammānaṃ āyu na vattabba
translated: Yes.
Is the life-faculty of form-sphere and formless-sphere phenomena not to be called the formless life-faculty?
You shouldn’t say so.
Is there no form-sphere life-faculty?
Yes.
Is there no life-faculty of one who has attained cessation?
You shouldn’t say so.
Is there a life-faculty of one who has attained cessation?

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci nirodhaṁ samāpannassa atthi jīvitindriyaṁ, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci nirodham samāpannassa atthi jīvitindriya no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: Yes.
Well then, since there is a life-faculty of one who has attained cessation, you should say that there is a form-sphere life-faculty.
Is there a life faculty of one who has attained cessation?
“Yes.”
“In which aggregate is it included?”
“In the formation aggregate.”

analyzed: nirodham samāpannassa atthi saṅkhāra kkhandho ti
translated: “Is there a formation aggregate of one who has attained cessation?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the eye-consciousness element?” …

analyzed: nirodham samāpannassa atthi saṅkhāra kkhandho ti
translated: “Is there a formation aggregate of one who has attained cessation?”

analyzed: āmantā  nirodham samāpannassa atthi vedanā khandhaḥ pe  saññā khandhaḥ pe
translated: “Yes.”🔽“Is there a feeling aggregate …🔽a perception aggregate …
a consciousness aggregate of one who has attained cessation?”

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….🔽Nirodhaṁ samāpannassa atthi vedanākkhandho …pe…🔽saññākkhandho …pe…
analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  nirodham samāpannassa atthi vedanā khandhaḥ pe  saññā khandhaḥ pe
translated: “No.”🔽“Is there a feeling aggregate …🔽a perception aggregate …
a consciousness aggregate of one who has attained cessation?”
“Yes.”🔽“Is it not the case that one has not attained cessation?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the mind-object sense-sphere?” …
“Is it the case that there is no material life faculty?”
“Yes.”
“Is it the case that there is no life faculty of the immaterial sentient beings?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …
“Is it the case that there is a life faculty of the immaterial sentient beings?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci asaññasattānaṁ atthi jīvitindriyaṁ, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci asaññasattānam atthi jīvitindriya no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Are there any beings without thought who have the life faculty? No, friends, you shouldn’t say that.
“Are there any beings without thought who don’t have the material life faculty?
“Are there any beings without thought who have the life faculty?
“Yes.
“In which aggregate is it included?
“In the formations aggregate.
“Are there any beings without thought who have the formations aggregate?
“No, friends, you shouldn’t say that.
“Are there any beings without thought who have the formations aggregate?
“Yes.
“Are there any beings without thought who have the feeling aggregate …
the perception aggregate …
the consciousness aggregate?

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  asaññasattānam atthi vedanā khandho pe  saññā khandhaḥ pe
translated: “No, friends, you shouldn’t say that.
“Are there any beings without thought who have the consciousness aggregate?
“Yes.
“Are they five-constituent beings?
“No, friends, you shouldn’t say that.

original: Upapattesiyena cittena samuṭṭhitaṁ jīvitindriyaṁ upapattesiye citte bhijjamāne ekadesaṁ bhijjatīti?
analyzed: upapattesiyena cittena samuṭṭhitam jīvitindriyam upapattesiye citte bhijjamāne eka desam bhijjati iti
translated: “Is the life faculty arisen from the mind of rebirth of the beings without thought destroyed when the mind of rebirth is destroyed?
“Yes.

original: Upapattesiyena cittena samuṭṭhito phasso upapattesiye citte bhijjamāne ekadeso bhijjatīti?
analyzed: upapattesiyena cittena samuṭṭhitaḥ phassaḥ upapattesiye citte bhijjamāne eka desaḥ bhijjati iti
translated: When the contact arisen with rebirth-linking consciousness breaks up, does one part of it break up with the rebirth-linking consciousness?
… ‘It is not so, friend.’

original: Upapattesiyena cittena samuṭṭhito phasso upapattesiye citte bhijjamāne anavaseso bhijjatīti?
analyzed: upapattesiyena cittena samuṭṭhitaḥ phassaḥ upapattesiye citte bhijjamāne anavasesaḥ bhijjati iti
translated: … ‘When the contact arisen with rebirth-linking consciousness breaks up, does the whole of it break up with the rebirth-linking consciousness?’
… ‘Yes.’

original: Upapattesiyena cittena samuṭṭhitaṁ jīvitindriyaṁ upapattesiye citte bhijjamāne anavasesaṁ bhijjatīti?
analyzed: upapattesiyena cittena samuṭṭhitam jīvitindriyam upapattesiye citte bhijjamāne anavasesam bhijjati iti
translated: … ‘When the life faculty arisen with rebirth-linking consciousness breaks up, does the whole of it break up with the rebirth-linking consciousness?’
… ‘It is not so, friend.’
… ‘Are there two life faculties?’
… ‘Yes.’

original: Dvīhi jīvitehi jīvati, dvīhi maraṇehi mīyatīti?
analyzed: dvīhi jīvitehi jīvati dvīhi maraṇehi mīyati iti
translated: … ‘Does one live with two life faculties and die with two deaths?’
… ‘Yes.’
The Discussion of the Life Faculty is finished.
